intro: Amaracarpus ledermannii, commonly known as the Ledermann's amara, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
